metadata.Description: Geothermal energy is heat derived within the sub-surface of the earth. It is a renewable source of energy that can be used for heating, cooling, and electricity generation.

geothermal energy.Description: Geothermal energy implements Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
Geothermal energy funds Research and Development to explore new technologies and improve efficiency.
Geothermal energy focuses on Renewable Energy Sources to reduce reliance on fossil fuels.
Geothermal energy is included in the Energy Transition Strategy to achieve a sustainable energy mix.
Geothermal energy partners with Local Communities to ensure their involvement and support in sustainable energy projects.
Geothermal energy contributes to Climate Change Mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Geothermal energy monitors Energy Production to optimize efficiency and ensure sustainable operations.
Geothermal energy targets increased Renewable Energy Capacity to meet sustainable energy goals.
